title: Confirmed: KYS is not punished as long as they type "KMS" and you say "do it"

embed.description: Easily capture screenshots, GIFs, and replays that are ready to share. Download the free app for windows and mac.

body:
Someone did this in my game while soft inting the team, forcing us to lose. Full context:

"this is why you'll be plat forever"
"kms"
"plz do"

Did not get detected by IFS. Upon ticketing and receiving several replies from Riot support and providing screenshot evidence just to make their jobs easier, he is not banned. Pretty disgusting and unacceptable. PM me for evidence, due to stupid ass name and shame rules I can't provide meaningful evidence with names publicly.

replies.body:
You're saying that kys isn't punished
And your proof is the fact that someone didn't say kys
What?
{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

Right, but using the phrase "kys" is what's **zero tolerance**. Against the rules does not by default mean zero tolerance. The zero tolerance list is **intentionally** limited to phrases that are **so insanely inappropriate in every situation** that no sane human would think they're okay.

"plz do" is not even a sentence that makes sense in the first place, much less something that could be deemed "insanely inappropriate".

You make absolutely no sense. It's insanely inappropriate to encourage suicide regardless of how you express it. There's nothing special about the acronym, they're just 3 letters, what's zero tolerance is the idea behind them, and that idea is being expressed here.

You think. That's your interpretation.

We don't have the rest of the conversation, nor do we know if they were on League Voice or Discord with a party member and replying to something they said in chat.

"plz do" is not inappropriate. Period.

Cait was already duo with support, there was no other interactions or messages in chat that he could have been talking to, and you are smarter than this. Stop playing dumb and making excuses for bad people.

There's no playing dumb or excuses.

You are being intentionally blind and oblivious to any other explanation - and this is a prime example of one big reason Riot won't re-implement the Tribunal or just punish people based on what players claim.

Saying "plz do" can be for any number of reasons, and the fact it coincidentally came after someone else said "kms" does **NOT** mean that it is related to that person saying "kms". You do not have any way to confirm or deny what was said, and someone is not going to be punished just because you want them to be.

ZT system is indeed a word filter and not using the ML system, which is the system that understands the context of how the speech was used. 

Even if the system used the ML review method, it will still just scan the reported person's logs and not scan the log it was replying to. 

Your tickets to support will at best queue up the game for a manual review, which I suspect will be severely  backed up due to increase in volume of reports and lesser working staff during the holidays.
Who is saying what to who? Did you mean that he was trying to convey the idea of 'kys' by using 'kms' instead?
